title: Christmas Wishes
description: Andy tries to make this year's Christmas the best ever by granting each person's holiday wishes. Meanwhile, Robert California tries to drown his sorrows at the office party.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Singing as if he were the dolls in his office] Christmas tiiiime is heeeere! [Normal voice] Wow. Thanks guys, that sounded amazing. Hi, I'm Andy Bernard and I am the first office Santa ever to make holiday wishes come true.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who's excited to get their holiday wishes?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Holiday wishes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's that, Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We know exactly what holiday you're referring to.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It is important to be mindful of all belief systems at our holiday party.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I've been here eighteen years and have suffered through some weird thematic Christmases. A Honolulu Christmas, A Pulp Fiction Christmas, A Muslim Christmas, Moroccan Christmas. Mo-rocca Christmas. I don't want it. Christmas is Christmas is Christmas is Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I got Stanley tickets to see Lewis Black for his birthday. ...Might not have been the best idea.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't want no Kwanza wreath, I don't need a dreidel in my face, that's it's own thing. And who's that black Santa for?! I don't care! I know Santa ain't black! I could care less. I want Christmas! Just give me plain baby Jesus, lying in a manger, Christmas!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What is the status on my wish?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Fulfilled! Brought my bicycle, so I can be your designated driver later. In the event that you drink to much, which is by no means required.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What about my wish that we don't have to attend meetings that degrade our sense of adulthood?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That, I cannot do, but I did get you an acre of property on the moon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where? Dark side or light side?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Light side.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Is it by the Sea of Tranquility?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: As a matter of fact, yes. Directly adjacent....beachfront.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, who's wish is next? Oh, what about Santa's wish? My biggest wish is that you all get along well with Jessica....C'mon guys, Jessica?...Jim, tell 'em who Jessica is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: She's not your grandmother, is she?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ugh! Gam-gam's name is Ruth, Jim, you should know. I introduced you on speakerphone that time?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jessica is my super serious girlfriend, who is seriously awesome and seriously sexy. Only thing that's not serious, by the way? Our repartee.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That's great. When you know you know. Hey, what's Ruth's deal, man?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Totally out of your league. So in summation, ho ho ho, please be nice to Jessica and mistletoe is not an excuse for sexual assault, and don't go near Gam-gam.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I love Jessica, and I haven't even met her yet. It's like we don't even need to meet, you know? I already love you. Stay home.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I just want you to know that I will be mean to Jessica if you want me to be.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh no, no. It's fine, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It's really no problem. I was already planning on being mean to her.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That's OK, I don't want you to do that.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [laughing] Hello, ah. Merry Christmas, Erin. Kelly, Happy Pancha Ganapati.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Eww, what is that?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: The five day Hindu celebration in December honoring the god Ganesh, Patron of the Arts.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, man.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Hey! [Kevin embraces Robert in a tight hug] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: How ya holdin' up...because of your wife leaving you?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Kevin?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I actually appreciate the human intimacy. Feel like a kitten being cradled by a gorilla.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's been ten days since I had sexual intercourse.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well you came to the right place....Ah, this, this party'll cheer you right up.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I hope so. The corporate party was wretched. I am so tired of the Black Eyed Peas. It's rock-n-roll for people who don't like rock-n-roll. It's rap for people who don't like rap. It's pop for people who don't like pop.....ah, heartbreaking. [gestures to Andy in Santa costume]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I hate to have to take my Santa hat off, and put on my hard ass hat. [puts on baseball cap that has a foam rear-end on it with the words "HARD ASS"] But, this is serious. It's come to my attention that somebody who shall remain nameless, wants to switch desk clumps.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine with me. Jim can leave anytime he wants. Goodbye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It wasn't me.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It wasn't either of you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kathy wants to leave our clump?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sh sh sh sh! Don't look. Who it was is not important...but she did say that your constant pranking and one-upsmanship is driving her crazy. She or he.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I just wanna say, this is not my fault. OK? The weak always bully the strong. Contrary to what you see in the media. I am always acting in self-defense. Occasionally preemptive self-defense. [punches Jim in the arm]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ow, What are you doing? [Jim fights back]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey! Hey! Respect the hat!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam never seemed to have a problem with us.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright. I'm gonna speak in a language you both understand....Mo-nay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What was that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Money....You both have sizable Christmas bonuses coming your way. If I catch either of you messing with the other, I will give both bonuses to the other person.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Can't do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, absolutely not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You need consequences. OK? I want you both walking on eggshells.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Hi. I'm Jessica. I'm looking for Andy?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Jessica. Yes. We don't say hi, we hug. [gets up and hugs Jessica] I'm Erin.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Oh! [laughs] Oof!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry, hi, I hope you feel really welcome, we all want you here.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My ex is meeting my sex....which is always scary, you know? And not just because you think they might talk about your penis...that's just part of it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey! Jess, Erin, I hope you're not talking about my penis. [laughs and kisses Jessica on the cheek] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey everyone! I want you to meet Jessica, she is an assistant cross country coach at Bryn Mawr.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin, by the way, amazing receptionist.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Oh, that's great. Backbone of the office.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Which is funny, actually, because my spine is a mess.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Scoliosis. Had to wear a back brace for three years but I never did. [Jessica laughs, Erin exaggerates back curve]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Ah..[laughs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ut oh, it's kicking in. Spontaneous scoliosis.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Spontaneous scoliosis. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: This thing could take your arm off, your head off, you know, just exercise caution.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh yeah, and um there's a Christmas party upstairs tonight, wanted to tell you about.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Isn't that just for popsicles?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Popsicles?

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeah, upstairs people? Cause you got a stick up your butt?

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: Ah! See, I, I, I thought it was because they're so rich they could all eat popsicles all the time. [laughs] I, in my, I...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Well you should definitely come. The foreman always comes. Plus it's fun, you know cookies, smoked fish, alcohol, people acting stupid.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: You had me at "clookies." I can't wait to find out what they are.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: What should I wear?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, it's nice, it's real nice. People get dressed up.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: I will look so handsome for you, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah...[sees Dwight's wallet and open email] I'm gonna s- [see's Dwight watching from break room]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight really wants my bonus. He's trying to entrap me. Oh god, now I can't drink at this thing....I get really pranky when I drink.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Erin, what can I get for you?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh, do you have cola? Kirkland if you have it.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Now why would you come to a bar and ask for a cola when you can get some from the kitchen? Did some small part of you want something a little stronger? Ryan, Kevin, Phyllis, Oscar, come and take these shots!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Will do.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: The fifth one is for you, Erin. You could take it or leave it. To take it would be to accept that you're at a party and you're an adult woman, with an adventurous spirit. To leave it would be fine too.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: One, two three! [group takes shots]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: OK. [takes shot, group laughs]

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Mmm. Wow.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Whoo! Jiminy Christmas!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Jiminey Christmas indeed.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hit 'er up.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh yes.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah! [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Uh, yeah. I just got my replacement credit card...you want the number? Oh it's uh four seven nine three, zero zero three two, three three one three. The security code is nine two seven. OK great. Thank you very much. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So Dwight did take the bait. He used my credit card numbers to send a two hundred dollar bouquet of flowers, to my wife...from me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughing] Boom!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: But look, it's Christmas, so you're allowed...[Val walks in dressed very formally] whoa, hello. Um, you're allowed to do...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Good cookie.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I meant dressed up compared to normal. You usually dress like a ghost-buster.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I thought you'd wear a sweater.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Since when does a sweater mean "dressed up"? Am I your grandson?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Come on, stay, alright? It's good for people to get to know you.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: As a contestant on Dancing with the Stars, maybe.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [imitating Stanley] I want.. my sugar free cookie, and then I want a sugar cookie. [group laughs] and then I want my nap!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: That's right. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Whoo! [group laughs] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: She, she is remarkable.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Edgy impressions.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How many drinks have you had tonight? I can't be driving everybody home.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: A thousand.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa! Maybe you should take a break.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [serious] Maybe you should mind your own business. [normal voice] Just kidding!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah! I've been attacked! Oh my god! Oh! Someone put a porcupine in my drawer!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, I was just sitting here at my desk and I, I reached into my drawer to grab my toothbrush and some tooth powder and, and all of a sudden I was attacked by this blood thirsty rabid creature!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I wonder, in this office, who has access to a porcupine?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or who in this office knows that I have access and is trying to set me up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know this sounds a lot like the premise of my latest Chad Flendermen novel. A murder for framing.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Chad Flendermen. Just an easy going black guy, he knows the streets, yet he also went to Oxford. So. Just as comfortable on a motorcycle as he is on Air Force One. Oh and he's also the world's leading Egyptologist.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Toby! Nobody cares about your sex-crazed black detective.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no. Women chase him. He misses his wife.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello? Lacerated hand here folks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nice try, this is ridiculous.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh is it really? Two separate times you have set me up to believe I was being recruited by the CIA.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Three times.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You see?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Jim, this has your fingerprints all over it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, you've gotta be kidding me.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Fingerprints can be planted. You know with a severed hand...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Do you think that's what happened? Do you think he used a severed hand?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, you know what? Why don't we just call animal control...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Might wanna run that by Angela cause it's so cute.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No. Porcupines don't have souls. They're like dogs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] Yes, I'm calling from Dunder Mifflin. We have a very rabid porcupine in our office, someone should come pick it up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come down right away!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone]Uh, I don't know, let me ask. [to Dwight] Uh, were you quilled?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, I was quilled.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And what's it's name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Henrietta.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oops. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? ...Alright, get her out of here, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dynamite by Taio Cruz plays in the background]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, guys. I just wanted to say. Come here! I'm so happy you guys are together. OK? [Andy and Jessica laugh] And you both have such beautiful hair.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: [laughs] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I hope you guys get married....and who knows? Maybe at the wedding, I meet someone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And later on tonight, I hope I see you guys kiss. [blows kisses and pushes Andy and Jessica's faces together.] Ah! [laughs] OK, well I'm gonna go do another reverse spit. That's how the cool kids say "get a drink". [blows kisses and dances away]

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: That's uh, that's the girl you dated.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, yeah, she's not always like that. It's um...

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: No, she, she seems fine.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, uh, excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yep. [leaves Jessica to talk to Erin] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Have you had anything to eat besides candy canes?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Every martini has an olive.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK...maybe I should make you some oatmeal or something.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I don't wanna put you out, but if someone's making oatmeal, I'll take a apple cinnamon and a maple brown sugar in one bowl with whole milk.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, I never told you my Christmas wish.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah, OK.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's about you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's not what it should be, it should just be like a trinket or something.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [slurring slightly] It's that I wish Jessica was dead.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You you, wait. You mean you wish she wasn't here or something.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I wish she was in a graveyard! Under the ground...with worms coming out of her mouth.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, you know, you can't say that, OK? That's my girlfriend that you're talking about. You and I are not together anymore. You need to get over it! Take your wish back.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Too late! It's already been wished! And you promised it would come true. You wrote it in an email! So, which one are you? A murderer or a liar? [Andy leaves]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So, there was talk of oatmeal.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You know, don't listen to what anyone is saying. You look like a, a princess.

quotes.speaker: Val
quotes.text: Yeah. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I swear...

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Did you not...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was too embarrassed! [group laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey guys, sorry to interrupt, I uh, just found this on my desk. [shows picture of Cici with devil doodles] Need to talk to somebody about it. Can you believe that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Is that Cici?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. It is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's awful.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Cici is Jim's daughter.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Oh my god. How could somebody do that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know, I mean the way I see it is you can deface any picture of me, any one, pick one. Not my kid though.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Who did this? Who did this? Do you know who did this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know who did this....Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: He should pay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. He is gonna pay. This is fire-able.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's, I mean.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let me just see that one more time. Yep, you know what? I know who my friends are, now. But I shouldn't have got you involved because the truth is, I don't even really care about this picture, it's a little out of focus. It was probably an accident, right? Like...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: That's no accident.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right. You're right. So maybe it was me who did it...by accident.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'll figure it out, get to the bottom of it....Merry merry.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Christmas Time is Here by Vince Guaraldi Trio is playing in the background]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Enough of this garbage. [harshly places boom box on table and hits play] This is Christmas. [Christmas Eve by Trans-Siberian Orchestra plays. Dwight plays air violin/guitar and sings along] Hi-yah!!!!! [gabe, Creed and Nate join in as shots show various gift giving] Yeah!!!! Christmas!!!!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You alright, Santa?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know those movies where two friends are sleeping together and it's like, hey, can they stay friends?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you think two friends who are not sleeping together can stay friends?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Two friends who are not sleeping together, can they remain friends? Yes, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No...I don't, hmm, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: By the way, I'm not gonna mess with you and Dwight's bonuses. I think it's causing more problems. So just be yourselves, have fun, and try not to let it affect your work.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright. I will definitely do that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, I'll tell Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what? You're sitting, and thinking, and it's probably better if it comes from me anyway.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Christmas miracles do happen.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes. They totally do.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You can't click on these Kardashian links, that's why you have so many viruses.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well help me, OK? Just, uh take...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm trying but you need to-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yo.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Game on.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: On it.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: [group laughing] I don't know what I was thinking, it was awful...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Jessica, did you just fart? [group stops laughing]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: And that, is how it's done.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I would like another alcohol.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Let's you and I take a walk. Oscar, you're in charge of the bar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What? I haven't bar tended in forever. Oh, never considered myself a mixologist, oh this is daunting. Um, I need a mortar, pestle, muddler..does anyone have any chocolate shavings?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Your heart is broken. So is mine.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: And what?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: And you have any advice or anything?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No [laughs] my god.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: ...Help me feel better...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I've been married thrice and each has ended in an acrimonious divorce, I'm not sure I'm the best person to give love advice....I was hoping you were gonna make me feel better.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: When you do your makeup,

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Nate
quotes.text: How long you, does it take usually? Cause...

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Um, it ta-, um it depends.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: .....Chad Flendermen's kryptonite. [Darryl walks up to Toby and Val in a tuxedo]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Whoa. We got a real Clarence Thomas here.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: I'll see you at home?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK great.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: OK

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Bye [kiss]...I still don't get why you can't just call her a cab and pay for it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I would, it just, that wasn't the holiday wish.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: Oh

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Either he drives or I drive. Now I'm drunk and mad.

quotes.speaker: Jessica
quotes.text: OK [laughs] Bye.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK, bye. [helps Meredith off the floor] Alright Meredith,

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thank you Santa.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You bet.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank god Erin's getting a ride home with Robert because she is trashed. [laughs] and who better to drive her home than Robert, I mean, what a stand up guy, you know? I mean he's going through a lot, separating from his wife, showing up to the Christmas party in a track suit and a blazer,

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's go, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I know, I'm coming, I'm coming, I'm coming, I'm coming, I'm coming.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hang on.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Alright. [Andy opens back of her van, things fall out]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Whoa! My stuff!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What is all that?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: It's my valuables!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's junk!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: This is my treasures, no they're my treasures!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're a hoarder. My god!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No I'm not, I'm gonna sell it on Ebay! No no no, you be careful. Be careful.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah! My Santa suit's stuck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [laughs while spray painting "Jim is Awesome" on his own car, talks to porcupine in carrier] What are we gonna do with all that bonus money, Henrietta? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Where are we? This ain't my street.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sh, sh, sh, sh, shh.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ah, this is the posh part of town, huh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wonder what a studio condo would cost in this neighborhood?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Meredith, shut your drunk hole right now.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Erin, it was great fun tonight. Take a few aspirin and a whole lot of water, sleep in in the morning.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thank you, goodnight.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: What are you smiling for? You thinkin' what I'm thinkin'?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm sure I am not. Let's get you home.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Ow! Take it easy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [yawns, "Idiot" is written on his forehead] Ah, man. Ah, fell asleep, took a nap. Hey guys, ah I feel refreshed now. How's it goin?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Took a little nap right next to Jim's desk. I feel so good right now. Mmm, cookies. What's everyone staring at?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh man, I was supposed to tell Dwight something......C'mon, Jim. [shakes head] I got nothin'.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Where can I get a drink? Oh...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, uh. Well, we thought we wouldn't put the alcohol out till 11AM. It's just...common...decency.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Par for the course. Par for the...freaking course. I'll be in the party room having a cookie until 11. Haha! Yule-log.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Not destroyed. No..... Not destructive. Quite...off-kilter, sure. But... that's too vague. [long pause] Erratic. Darkly erratic. [laughs awkwardly] That's my mood.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Cake?...You seem a little down.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I am. [laughs] I'm a mess.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: How about I fix you some warm milk with some bourbon?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Oh, that sounds nice.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Maybe watch a movie...under a blanket...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Lovely. Wait, where is this taking place?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: The Murphy bed of my basement.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: What...is happening to me? [pause] The lines in your haggard face are paths that lead nowhere. Your hair is the fire of hell. [hugs Meredith] I sincerely hope you find a sexual partner tonight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's come to my attention that someone, who shall remain nameless, wants to switch desk clumps.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Cathy wants to leave our clump?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Don't look. Who it was is not important...but she did say that your constant pranking and one-upsmanship is driving her crazy. She or he.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Enjoy your new clump.

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's so much closer to the bathroom, right?

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry it didn't work out. Hope you find what you're looking for.

quotes.speaker: Kathy
quotes.text: No, I just have more room.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You'll be fine over there.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [talking loudly] Sorry guys, Jim! This package came for you, do you want me to put it on your desk?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That'd be great, thank you. [Erin throws package, it hits Kathy. She thinks it was Jim who threw it]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, I got this bucket from Jim's garage and I filled it with everything disgusting. Except excrement. I can't wait to see the look on his face when that falls on my face. [laughs, then camera shows bucket being dumped on Kathy] Dammit Kathy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: For the past month, I have been collecting wishes from everyone in the office, and I intend to make good on every single one of them.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, I see.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Now look, I may not have a great laugh like Santa, or a flying sled. But tell you what I do have. A Prius, a heart of freaking gold....

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright, you got it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: ...and an American Express green card.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ryan, for your holiday wish, you wanted ten sick days.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'd be satisfied with eight.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well I'll do you one better.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Nine?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I got you health insurance.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, neat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! Right? But with great perks come great responsibility, so I'm gonna be expecting a lot more from you...no more zoning out in your office.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!
